paragraphs.content: Chapter 24
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 24

paragraphs.content: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

paragraphs.content: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.

paragraphs.content: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.

paragraphs.content: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

paragraphs.content: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.

paragraphs.content: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.

paragraphs.content: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

paragraphs.content: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

paragraphs.content: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;
paragraphs.contentHtml: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;

paragraphs.content: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

paragraphs.content: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.

paragraphs.content: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

paragraphs.content: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.

paragraphs.content: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.

paragraphs.content: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.

paragraphs.content: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.

paragraphs.content: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.

paragraphs.content: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.

paragraphs.content: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

paragraphs.content: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.

paragraphs.content: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.

paragraphs.content: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.

paragraphs.content: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.

paragraphs.content: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
